constraint.description: This story is documentation and repository metadata focused - NO code implementation required. All tasks involve creating/updating documentation files, reviewing Git history, and configuring GitHub repository settings.

The most important task is creating summary.md with AI impact analysis. This is REQUIRED for educational assessment. Must demonstrate: understanding of AI tools, critical thinking about AI assistance, honest reflection on pros/cons, quantifiable impact metrics. See Dev Notes in story file for complete template.

Review Git history but DO NOT rewrite or amend existing commits. Git history should remain intact showing development progression through all 6 epics. Only ensure commits follow professional conventions.
Use MIT License for open source licensing. Include copyright year 2025 and copyright holder Deyvid. Standard MIT License template provided in Task 4 of story file.

Repository must be suitable for portfolio use and impressive to potential employers. Demonstrates: professional coding standards, comprehensive documentation, systematic Git workflow, testing discipline, DevOps deployment, BMAD methodology, critical AI reflection.

Must meet all educational assessment criteria: Functional (app works) ✓, Deployed (public URL) ✓, Documented (README + summary.md + prompts.md), AI Impact (summary.md analysis), Repository Quality (this story). All criteria listed in PRD Success Criteria section.

All BMAD phases must be documented and traceable: Phase 1 (product-brief.md), Phase 2 (PRD.md, epics.md), Phase 3 (architecture.md), Phase 4 (sprint-status.yaml, 30 story files, testing docs). Development progression should be clear from documentation.
